00068 static inline int osd_object_is_zap(dmu_buf_t *db)
00069 {
00070         dmu_buf_impl_t *dbi = (dmu_buf_impl_t *) db;
00071         dnode_t *dn;
00072         int rc;
00073 
00074         DB_DNODE_ENTER(dbi);
00075         dn = DB_DNODE(dbi);
00076         rc = (dn->dn_type == DMU_OT_DIRECTORY_CONTENTS ||
00077                         dn->dn_type == DMU_OT_USERGROUP_USED);
00078         DB_DNODE_EXIT(dbi);
00079 
00080         return rc;
00081 }
00082 
00083 /* We don't actually have direct access to the zap_hashbits() function
00084  * so just pretend like we do for now.  If this ever breaks we can look at
00085  * it at that time. */
00086 #define zap_hashbits(zc) 48
00087 /*
00088  * ZFS hash format:
00089  * | cd (16 bits) | hash (48 bits) |
00090  * we need it in other form:
00091  * |0| hash (48 bit) | cd (15 bit) |
00092  * to be a full 64-bit ordered hash so that Lustre readdir can use it to merge
00093  * the readdir hashes from multiple directory stripes uniformly on the client.
00094  * Another point is sign bit, the hash range should be in [0, 2^63-1] because
00095  * loff_t (for llseek) needs to be a positive value.  This means the "cd" field
00096  * should only be the low 15 bits.
00097  */
00098 uint64_t osd_zap_cursor_serialize(zap_cursor_t *zc)
00099 {
00100         uint64_t zfs_hash = zap_cursor_serialize(zc) & (~0ULL >> 1);
00101 
00102         return (zfs_hash >> zap_hashbits(zc)) |
00103                 (zfs_hash << (63 - zap_hashbits(zc)));
00104 }
00105 
00106 void osd_zap_cursor_init_serialized(zap_cursor_t *zc, struct objset *os,
00107                                     uint64_t id, uint64_t dirhash)
00108 {
00109         uint64_t zfs_hash = ((dirhash << zap_hashbits(zc)) & (~0ULL >> 1)) |
00110                 (dirhash >> (63 - zap_hashbits(zc)));
00111 
00112         zap_cursor_init_serialized(zc, os, id, zfs_hash);
00113 }
00114 
00115 int osd_zap_cursor_init(zap_cursor_t **zc, struct objset *os,
00116                         uint64_t id, uint64_t dirhash)
00117 {
00118         zap_cursor_t *t;
00119 
00120         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(t);
00121         if (unlikely(t == NULL))
00122                 return -ENOMEM;
00123 
00124         osd_zap_cursor_init_serialized(t, os, id, dirhash);
00125         *zc = t;
00126 
00127         return 0;
00128 }
00129 
00130 void osd_zap_cursor_fini(zap_cursor_t *zc)
00131 {
00132         zap_cursor_fini(zc);
00133         OBD_FREE_PTR(zc);
00134 }

00136 static inline void osd_obj_cursor_init_serialized(zap_cursor_t *zc,
00137                                                  struct osd_object *o,
00138                                                  uint64_t dirhash)
00139 {
00140         struct osd_device *d = osd_obj2dev(o);
00141         osd_zap_cursor_init_serialized(zc, d->od_os,
00142                                        o->oo_db->db_object, dirhash);
00143 }

00145 static inline int osd_obj_cursor_init(zap_cursor_t **zc, struct osd_object *o,
00146                         uint64_t dirhash)
00147 {
00148         struct osd_device *d = osd_obj2dev(o);
00149         return osd_zap_cursor_init(zc, d->od_os, o->oo_db->db_object, dirhash);
00150 }

00152 static struct dt_it *osd_index_it_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00153                                        struct dt_object *dt,
00154                                        __u32 unused)
00155 {
00156         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00157         struct osd_zap_it       *it;
00158         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00159         struct lu_object        *lo  = &dt->do_lu;
00160         int                      rc;
00161         ENTRY;
00162 
00163         if (obj->oo_destroyed)
00164                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOENT));
00165 
00166         LASSERT(lu_object_exists(lo));
00167         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00168         LASSERT(osd_object_is_zap(obj->oo_db));
00169         LASSERT(info);
00170 
00171         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(it, osd_zapit_cachep, GFP_NOFS);
00172         if (it == NULL)
00173                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00174 
00175         rc = osd_obj_cursor_init(&it->ozi_zc, obj, 0);
00176         if (rc != 0) {
00177                 OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(it, osd_zapit_cachep);
00178                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00179         }
00180 
00181         it->ozi_obj   = obj;
00182         it->ozi_reset = 1;
00183         lu_object_get(lo);
00184 
00185         RETURN((struct dt_it *)it);
00186 }

00188 static void osd_index_it_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
00189 {
00190         struct osd_zap_it       *it     = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
00191         struct osd_object       *obj;
00192         ENTRY;
00193 
00194         LASSERT(it);
00195         LASSERT(it->ozi_obj);
00196 
00197         obj = it->ozi_obj;
00198 
00199         osd_zap_cursor_fini(it->ozi_zc);
00200         lu_object_put(env, &obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
00201         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(it, osd_zapit_cachep);
00202 
00203         EXIT;
00204 }

00210          *      next/finish. */

00213 static inline void osd_it_append_attrs(struct lu_dirent *ent, __u32 attr,
00214                                        int len, __u16 type)
00215 {
00216         const unsigned    align = sizeof(struct luda_type) - 1;
00217         struct luda_type *lt;
00218 
00219         /* check if file type is required */
00220         if (attr & LUDA_TYPE) {
00221                 len = (len + align) & ~align;
00222 
00223                 lt = (void *)ent->lde_name + len;
00224                 lt->lt_type = cpu_to_le16(DTTOIF(type));
00225                 ent->lde_attrs |= LUDA_TYPE;
00226         }
00227 
00228         ent->lde_attrs = cpu_to_le32(ent->lde_attrs);
00229 }

00242 static int osd_get_fid_by_oid(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00243                               uint64_t oid, struct lu_fid *fid)
00244 {
00245         struct objset           *os       = osd->od_os;
00246         struct osd_thread_info  *oti      = osd_oti_get(env);
00247         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma      =
00248                         (struct lustre_mdt_attrs *)oti->oti_buf;
00249         struct lu_buf            buf;
00250         nvlist_t                *sa_xattr = NULL;
00251         sa_handle_t             *sa_hdl   = NULL;
00252         uchar_t                 *nv_value = NULL;
00253         uint64_t                 xattr    = ZFS_NO_OBJECT;
00254         int                      size     = 0;
00255         int                      rc;
00256         ENTRY;
00257 
00258         rc = __osd_xattr_load(osd, oid, &sa_xattr);
00259         if (rc == -ENOENT)
00260                 goto regular;
00261 
00262         if (rc != 0)
00263                 GOTO(out, rc);
00264 
00265         rc = -nvlist_lookup_byte_array(sa_xattr, XATTR_NAME_LMA, &nv_value,
00266                                        &size);
00267         if (rc == -ENOENT)
00268                 goto regular;
00269 
00270         if (rc != 0)
00271                 GOTO(out, rc);
00272 
00273         if (unlikely(size > sizeof(oti->oti_buf)))
00274                 GOTO(out, rc = -ERANGE);
00275 
00276         memcpy(lma, nv_value, size);
00277 
00278         goto found;
00279 
00280 regular:
00281         rc = -sa_handle_get(os, oid, NULL, SA_HDL_PRIVATE, &sa_hdl);
00282         if (rc != 0)
00283                 GOTO(out, rc);
00284 
00285         rc = -sa_lookup(sa_hdl, SA_ZPL_XATTR(osd), &xattr, 8);
00286         sa_handle_destroy(sa_hdl);
00287         if (rc != 0)
00288                 GOTO(out, rc);
00289 
00290         buf.lb_buf = lma;
00291         buf.lb_len = sizeof(oti->oti_buf);
00292         rc = __osd_xattr_get_large(env, osd, xattr, &buf,
00293                                    XATTR_NAME_LMA, &size);
00294         if (rc != 0)
00295                 GOTO(out, rc);
00296 
00297 found:
00298         if (size < sizeof(*lma))
00299                 GOTO(out, rc = -EIO);
00300 
00301         lustre_lma_swab(lma);
00302         if (unlikely((lma->lma_incompat & ~LMA_INCOMPAT_SUPP) ||
00303                      CFS_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSD_LMA_INCOMPAT))) {
00304                 CWARN("%s: unsupported incompat LMA feature(s) %#x for "
00305                       "oid = "LPX64"\n", osd->od_svname,
00306                       lma->lma_incompat & ~LMA_INCOMPAT_SUPP, oid);
00307                 GOTO(out, rc = -EOPNOTSUPP);
00308         } else {
00309                 *fid = lma->lma_self_fid;
00310                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00311         }
00312 
00313 out:
00314         if (sa_xattr != NULL)
00315                 nvlist_free(sa_xattr);
00316         return rc;
00317 }
00318 
00319 /*
00320  * As we don't know FID, we can't use LU object, so this function
00321  * partially duplicate __osd_xattr_get() which is built around
00322  * LU-object and uses it to cache data like regular EA dnode, etc
00323  */
00324 static int osd_find_parent_by_dnode(const struct lu_env *env,
00325                                     struct dt_object *o,
00326                                     struct lu_fid *fid)
00327 {
00328         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(osd_dt_obj(o));
00329         sa_handle_t             *sa_hdl;
00330         uint64_t                 dnode = ZFS_NO_OBJECT;
00331         int                      rc;
00332         ENTRY;
00333 
00334         /* first of all, get parent dnode from own attributes */
00335         LASSERT(osd_dt_obj(o)->oo_db);
00336         rc = -sa_handle_get(osd->od_os, osd_dt_obj(o)->oo_db->db_object,
00337                             NULL, SA_HDL_PRIVATE, &sa_hdl);
00338         if (rc != 0)
00339                 RETURN(rc);
00340 
00341         rc = -sa_lookup(sa_hdl, SA_ZPL_PARENT(osd), &dnode, 8);
00342         sa_handle_destroy(sa_hdl);
00343         if (rc == 0)
00344                 rc = osd_get_fid_by_oid(env, osd, dnode, fid);
00345 
00346         RETURN(rc);
00347 }
00348 
00349 static int osd_find_parent_fid(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *o,
00350                                struct lu_fid *fid)
00351 {
00352         struct link_ea_header  *leh;
00353         struct link_ea_entry   *lee;
00354         struct lu_buf           buf;
00355         int                     rc;
00356         ENTRY;
00357 
00358         buf.lb_buf = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_buf;
00359         buf.lb_len = sizeof(osd_oti_get(env)->oti_buf);
00360 
00361         rc = osd_xattr_get(env, o, &buf, XATTR_NAME_LINK);
00362         if (rc == -ERANGE) {
00363                 rc = osd_xattr_get(env, o, &LU_BUF_NULL, XATTR_NAME_LINK);
00364                 if (rc < 0)
00365                         RETURN(rc);
00366                 LASSERT(rc > 0);
00367                 OBD_ALLOC(buf.lb_buf, rc);
00368                 if (buf.lb_buf == NULL)
00369                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00370                 buf.lb_len = rc;
00371                 rc = osd_xattr_get(env, o, &buf, XATTR_NAME_LINK);
00372         }
00373         if (rc < 0)
00374                 GOTO(out, rc);
00375         if (rc < sizeof(*leh) + sizeof(*lee))
00376                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00377 
00378         leh = buf.lb_buf;
00379         if (leh->leh_magic == __swab32(LINK_EA_MAGIC)) {
00380                 leh->leh_magic = LINK_EA_MAGIC;
00381                 leh->leh_reccount = __swab32(leh->leh_reccount);
00382                 leh->leh_len = __swab64(leh->leh_len);
00383         }
00384         if (leh->leh_magic != LINK_EA_MAGIC)
00385                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00386         if (leh->leh_reccount == 0)
00387                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODATA);
00388 
00389         lee = (struct link_ea_entry *)(leh + 1);
00390         fid_be_to_cpu(fid, (const struct lu_fid *)&lee->lee_parent_fid);
00391         rc = 0;
00392 
00393 out:
00394         if (buf.lb_buf != osd_oti_get(env)->oti_buf)
00395                 OBD_FREE(buf.lb_buf, buf.lb_len);
00396 
00397 #if 0
00398         /* this block can be enabled for additional verification
00399          * it's trying to match FID from LinkEA vs. FID from LMA */
00400         if (rc == 0) {
00401                 struct lu_fid fid2;
00402                 int rc2;
00403                 rc2 = osd_find_parent_by_dnode(env, o, &fid2);
00404                 if (rc2 == 0)
00405                         if (lu_fid_eq(fid, &fid2) == 0)
00406                                 CERROR("wrong parent: "DFID" != "DFID"\n",
00407                                        PFID(fid), PFID(&fid2));
00408         }
00409 #endif
00410 
00411         /* no LinkEA is found, let's try to find the fid in parent's LMA */
00412         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
00413                 rc = osd_find_parent_by_dnode(env, o, fid);
00414 
00415         RETURN(rc);
00416 }
00417 
00418 static int osd_dir_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00419                           struct dt_rec *rec, const struct dt_key *key)
00420 {
00421         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
00422         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00423         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00424         char               *name = (char *)key;
00425         int                 rc;
00426         ENTRY;
00427 
00428         LASSERT(osd_object_is_zap(obj->oo_db));
00429 
00430         if (name[0] == '.') {
00431                 if (name[1] == 0) {
00432                         const struct lu_fid *f = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
00433                         memcpy(rec, f, sizeof(*f));
00434                         RETURN(1);
00435                 } else if (name[1] == '.' && name[2] == 0) {
00436                         rc = osd_find_parent_fid(env, dt, (struct lu_fid *)rec);
00437                         RETURN(rc == 0 ? 1 : rc);
00438                 }
00439         }
00440 
00441         memset(&oti->oti_zde.lzd_fid, 0, sizeof(struct lu_fid));
00442         rc = -zap_lookup(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object,
00443                          (char *)key, 8, sizeof(oti->oti_zde) / 8,
00444                          (void *)&oti->oti_zde);
00445         if (rc != 0)
00446                 RETURN(rc);
00447 
00448         if (likely(fid_is_sane(&oti->oti_zde.lzd_fid))) {
00449                 memcpy(rec, &oti->oti_zde.lzd_fid, sizeof(struct lu_fid));
00450                 RETURN(1);
00451         }
00452 
00453         rc = osd_get_fid_by_oid(env, osd, oti->oti_zde.lzd_reg.zde_dnode,
00454                                 (struct lu_fid *)rec);
00455 
00456         RETURN(rc == 0 ? 1 : (rc == -ENOENT ? -ENODATA : rc));
00457 }

00459 static int osd_declare_dir_insert(const struct lu_env *env,
00460                                   struct dt_object *dt,
00461                                   const struct dt_rec *rec,
00462                                   const struct dt_key *key,
00463                                   struct thandle *th)
00464 {
00465         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00466         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00467         uint64_t object;
00468         ENTRY;
00469 
00470         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00471         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00472 
00473         /* This is for inserting dot/dotdot for new created dir. */
00474         if (obj->oo_db == NULL)
00475                 object = DMU_NEW_OBJECT;
00476         else
00477                 object = obj->oo_db->db_object;
00478 
00479         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, object);
00480         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, object, TRUE, (char *)key);
00481 
00482         RETURN(0);
00483 }
00484 
00493 struct osd_object *osd_object_find(const struct lu_env *env,
00494                                    struct dt_object *dt,
00495                                    const struct lu_fid *fid)
00496 {
00497         struct lu_device         *ludev = dt->do_lu.lo_dev;
00498         struct osd_object        *child = NULL;
00499         struct lu_object         *luch;
00500         struct lu_object         *lo;
00501 
00502         /*
00503          * at this point topdev might not exist yet
00504          * (i.e. MGS is preparing profiles). so we can
00505          * not rely on topdev and instead lookup with
00506          * our device passed as topdev. this can't work
00507          * if the object isn't cached yet (as osd doesn't
00508          * allocate lu_header). IOW, the object must be
00509          * in the cache, otherwise lu_object_alloc() crashes
00510          * -bzzz
00511          */
00512         luch = lu_object_find_at(env, ludev, fid, NULL);
00513         if (IS_ERR(luch))
00514                 return (void *)luch;
00515 
00516         if (lu_object_exists(luch)) {
00517                 lo = lu_object_locate(luch->lo_header, ludev->ld_type);
00518                 if (lo != NULL)
00519                         child = osd_obj(lo);
00520                 else
00521                         LU_OBJECT_DEBUG(D_ERROR, env, luch,
00522                                         "%s: object can't be located "DFID,
00523                                         osd_dev(ludev)->od_svname, PFID(fid));
00524 
00525                 if (child == NULL) {
00526                         lu_object_put(env, luch);
00527                         CERROR("%s: Unable to get osd_object "DFID"\n",
00528                                osd_dev(ludev)->od_svname, PFID(fid));
00529                         child = ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
00530                 }
00531         } else {
00532                 LU_OBJECT_DEBUG(D_ERROR, env, luch,
00533                                 "%s: lu_object does not exists "DFID,
00534                                 osd_dev(ludev)->od_svname, PFID(fid));
00535                 lu_object_put(env, luch);
00536                 child = ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
00537         }
00538 
00539         return child;
00540 }

00547 static inline void osd_object_put(const struct lu_env *env,
00548                                   struct osd_object *obj)
00549 {
00550         lu_object_put(env, &obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
00551 }

00553 static int osd_seq_exists(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00554                           u64 seq)
00555 {
00556         struct lu_seq_range     *range = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_seq_range;
00557         struct seq_server_site  *ss = osd_seq_site(osd);
00558         int                     rc;
00559         ENTRY;
00560 
00561         LASSERT(ss != NULL);
00562         LASSERT(ss->ss_server_fld != NULL);
00563 
00564         rc = osd_fld_lookup(env, osd, seq, range);
00565         if (rc != 0) {
00566                 if (rc != -ENOENT)
00567                         CERROR("%s: Can not lookup fld for "LPX64"\n",
00568                                osd_name(osd), seq);
00569                 RETURN(0);
00570         }
00571 
00572         RETURN(ss->ss_node_id == range->lsr_index);
00573 }
00574 
00575 static int osd_remote_fid(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00576                           const struct lu_fid *fid)
00577 {
00578         struct seq_server_site  *ss = osd_seq_site(osd);
00579         ENTRY;
00580 
00581         /* FID seqs not in FLDB, must be local seq */
00582         if (unlikely(!fid_seq_in_fldb(fid_seq(fid))))
00583                 RETURN(0);
00584 
00585         /* If FLD is not being initialized yet, it only happens during the
00586          * initialization, likely during mgs initialization, and we assume
00587          * this is local FID. */
00588         if (ss == NULL || ss->ss_server_fld == NULL)
00589                 RETURN(0);
00590 
00591         /* Only check the local FLDB here */
00592         if (osd_seq_exists(env, osd, fid_seq(fid)))
00593                 RETURN(0);
00594 
00595         RETURN(1);
00596 }
00597 
00610 static int osd_dir_insert(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00611                           const struct dt_rec *rec, const struct dt_key *key,
00612                           struct thandle *th, int ignore_quota)
00613 {
00614         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
00615         struct osd_object   *parent = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00616         struct osd_device   *osd = osd_obj2dev(parent);
00617         struct dt_insert_rec *rec1 = (struct dt_insert_rec *)rec;
00618         const struct lu_fid *fid = rec1->rec_fid;
00619         struct osd_thandle  *oh;
00620         struct osd_object   *child = NULL;
00621         __u32                attr;
00622         char                *name = (char *)key;
00623         int                  rc;
00624         ENTRY;
00625 
00626         LASSERT(parent->oo_db);
00627         LASSERT(osd_object_is_zap(parent->oo_db));
00628 
00629         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00630         LASSERT(osd_invariant(parent));
00631 
00632         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00633         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00634 
00635         rc = osd_remote_fid(env, osd, fid);
00636         if (rc < 0) {
00637                 CERROR("%s: Can not find object "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00638                        osd->od_svname, PFID(fid), rc);
00639                 RETURN(rc);
00640         }
00641 
00642         if (unlikely(rc == 1)) {
00643                 /* Insert remote entry */
00644                 memset(&oti->oti_zde.lzd_reg, 0, sizeof(oti->oti_zde.lzd_reg));
00645                 oti->oti_zde.lzd_reg.zde_type = IFTODT(rec1->rec_type & S_IFMT);
00646         } else {
00647                 /*
00648                  * To simulate old Orion setups with ./..  stored in the
00649                  * directories
00650                  */
00651                 /* Insert local entry */
00652                 child = osd_object_find(env, dt, fid);
00653                 if (IS_ERR(child))
00654                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(child));
00655 
00656                 LASSERT(child->oo_db);
00657                 if (name[0] == '.') {
00658                         if (name[1] == 0) {
00659                                 /* do not store ".", instead generate it
00660                                  * during iteration */
00661                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00662                         } else if (name[1] == '.' && name[2] == 0) {
00663                                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_BAD_PARENT)) {
00664                                         struct lu_fid tfid = *fid;
00665 
00666                                         osd_object_put(env, child);
00667                                         tfid.f_oid--;
00668                                         child = osd_object_find(env, dt, &tfid);
00669                                         if (IS_ERR(child))
00670                                                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(child));
00671 
00672                                         LASSERT(child->oo_db);
00673                                 }
00674 
00675                                 /* update parent dnode in the child.
00676                                  * later it will be used to generate ".." */
00677                                 rc = osd_object_sa_update(parent,
00678                                                  SA_ZPL_PARENT(osd),
00679                                                  &child->oo_db->db_object,
00680                                                  8, oh);
00681 
00682                                 GOTO(out, rc);
00683                         }
00684                 }
00685                 CLASSERT(sizeof(oti->oti_zde.lzd_reg) == 8);
00686                 CLASSERT(sizeof(oti->oti_zde) % 8 == 0);
00687                 attr = child->oo_dt.do_lu.lo_header ->loh_attr;
00688                 oti->oti_zde.lzd_reg.zde_type = IFTODT(attr & S_IFMT);
00689                 oti->oti_zde.lzd_reg.zde_dnode = child->oo_db->db_object;
00690         }
00691 
00692         oti->oti_zde.lzd_fid = *fid;
00693         /* Insert (key,oid) into ZAP */
00694         rc = -zap_add(osd->od_os, parent->oo_db->db_object,
00695                       (char *)key, 8, sizeof(oti->oti_zde) / 8,
00696                       (void *)&oti->oti_zde, oh->ot_tx);
00697         if (unlikely(rc == -EEXIST &&
00698                      name[0] == '.' && name[1] == '.' && name[2] == 0))
00699                 /* Update (key,oid) in ZAP */
00700                 rc = -zap_update(osd->od_os, parent->oo_db->db_object,
00701                                 (char *)key, 8, sizeof(oti->oti_zde) / 8,
00702                                 (void *)&oti->oti_zde, oh->ot_tx);
00703 
00704 out:
00705         if (child != NULL)
00706                 osd_object_put(env, child);
00707 
00708         RETURN(rc);
00709 }
00710 
00711 static int osd_declare_dir_delete(const struct lu_env *env,
00712                                   struct dt_object *dt,
00713                                   const struct dt_key *key,
00714                                   struct thandle *th)
00715 {
00716         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00717         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00718         uint64_t            dnode;
00719         ENTRY;
00720 
00721         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00722         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00723 
00724         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00725         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00726 
00727         if (dt_object_exists(dt)) {
00728                 LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00729                 LASSERT(osd_object_is_zap(obj->oo_db));
00730                 dnode = obj->oo_db->db_object;
00731         } else {
00732                 dnode = DMU_NEW_OBJECT;
00733         }
00734         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, dnode, TRUE, (char *)key);
00735 
00736         RETURN(0);
00737 }
00738 
00739 static int osd_dir_delete(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00740                           const struct dt_key *key, struct thandle *th)
00741 {
00742         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00743         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00744         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00745         dmu_buf_t *zap_db = obj->oo_db;
00746         char      *name = (char *)key;
00747         int rc;
00748         ENTRY;
00749 
00750         LASSERT(zap_db);
00751         LASSERT(osd_object_is_zap(zap_db));
00752 
00753         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00754         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00755 
00756         /*
00757          * In Orion . and .. were stored in the directory (not generated upon
00758          * request as now). we preserve them for backward compatibility
00759          */
00760         if (name[0] == '.') {
00761                 if (name[1] == 0) {
00762                         RETURN(0);
00763                 } else if (name[1] == '.' && name[2] == 0) {
00764                         RETURN(0);
00765                 }
00766         }
00767 
00768         /* Remove key from the ZAP */
00769         rc = -zap_remove(osd->od_os, zap_db->db_object,
00770                          (char *) key, oh->ot_tx);
00771 
00772         if (unlikely(rc && rc != -ENOENT))
00773                 CERROR("%s: zap_remove failed: rc = %d\n", osd->od_svname, rc);
00774 
00775         RETURN(rc);
00776 }
00777 
00778 static struct dt_it *osd_dir_it_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00779                                      struct dt_object *dt,
00780                                      __u32 unused)
00781 {
00782         struct osd_zap_it *it;
00783 
00784         it = (struct osd_zap_it *)osd_index_it_init(env, dt, unused);
00785         if (!IS_ERR(it))
00786                 it->ozi_pos = 0;
00787 
00788         RETURN((struct dt_it *)it);
00789 }
00790 
00801 static int osd_dir_it_get(const struct lu_env *env,
00802                           struct dt_it *di, const struct dt_key *key)
00803 {
00804         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
00805         struct osd_object *obj = it->ozi_obj;
00806         char              *name = (char *)key;
00807         int                rc;
00808         ENTRY;
00809 
00810         LASSERT(it);
00811         LASSERT(it->ozi_zc);
00812 
00813         /* reset the cursor */
00814         zap_cursor_fini(it->ozi_zc);
00815         osd_obj_cursor_init_serialized(it->ozi_zc, obj, 0);
00816 
00817         /* XXX: implementation of the API is broken at the moment */
00818         LASSERT(((const char *)key)[0] == 0);
00819 
00820         if (name[0] == 0) {
00821                 it->ozi_pos = 0;
00822                 RETURN(1);
00823         }
00824 
00825         if (name[0] == '.') {
00826                 if (name[1] == 0) {
00827                         it->ozi_pos = 1;
00828                         GOTO(out, rc = 1);
00829                 } else if (name[1] == '.' && name[2] == 0) {
00830                         it->ozi_pos = 2;
00831                         GOTO(out, rc = 1);
00832                 }
00833         }
00834 
00835         /* neither . nor .. - some real record */
00836         it->ozi_pos = 3;
00837         rc = +1;
00838 
00839 out:
00840         RETURN(rc);
00841 }
00842 
00843 static void osd_dir_it_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
00844 {
00845         /* PBS: do nothing : ref are incremented at retrive and decreamented
00846          *      next/finish. */
00847 }
00848 
00849 /*
00850  * in Orion . and .. were stored in the directory, while ZPL
00851  * and current osd-zfs generate them up on request. so, we
00852  * need to ignore previously stored . and ..
00853  */
00854 static int osd_index_retrieve_skip_dots(struct osd_zap_it *it,
00855                                         zap_attribute_t *za)
00856 {
00857         int rc, isdot;
00858 
00859         do {
00860                 rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za);
00861 
00862                 isdot = 0;
00863                 if (unlikely(rc == 0 && za->za_name[0] == '.')) {
00864                         if (za->za_name[1] == 0) {
00865                                 isdot = 1;
00866                         } else if (za->za_name[1] == '.' &&
00867                                    za->za_name[2] == 0) {
00868                                 isdot = 1;
00869                         }
00870                         if (unlikely(isdot))
00871                                 zap_cursor_advance(it->ozi_zc);
00872                 }
00873         } while (unlikely(rc == 0 && isdot));
00874 
00875         return rc;
00876 }
00877 
00888 static int osd_dir_it_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
00889 {
00890         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
00891         zap_attribute_t   *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00892         int                rc;
00893 
00894         ENTRY;
00895 
00896         /* temp. storage should be enough for any key supported by ZFS */
00897         CLASSERT(sizeof(za->za_name) <= sizeof(it->ozi_name));
00898 
00899         /*
00900          * the first ->next() moves the cursor to .
00901          * the second ->next() moves the cursor to ..
00902          * then we get to the real records and have to verify any exist
00903          */
00904         if (it->ozi_pos <= 2) {
00905                 it->ozi_pos++;
00906                 if (it->ozi_pos <=2)
00907                         RETURN(0);
00908 
00909         } else {
00910                 zap_cursor_advance(it->ozi_zc);
00911         }
00912 
00913         /*
00914          * According to current API we need to return error if its last entry.
00915          * zap_cursor_advance() does not return any value. So we need to call
00916          * retrieve to check if there is any record.  We should make
00917          * changes to Iterator API to not return status for this API
00918          */
00919         rc = osd_index_retrieve_skip_dots(it, za);
00920 
00921         if (rc == -ENOENT) /* end of dir */
00922                 RETURN(+1);
00923 
00924         RETURN(rc);
00925 }
00926 
00927 static struct dt_key *osd_dir_it_key(const struct lu_env *env,
00928                                      const struct dt_it *di)
00929 {
00930         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
00931         zap_attribute_t   *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00932         int                rc = 0;
00933         ENTRY;
00934 
00935         if (it->ozi_pos <= 1) {
00936                 it->ozi_pos = 1;
00937                 RETURN((struct dt_key *)".");
00938         } else if (it->ozi_pos == 2) {
00939                 RETURN((struct dt_key *)"..");
00940         }
00941 
00942         if ((rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za)))
00943                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00944 
00945         strcpy(it->ozi_name, za->za_name);
00946 
00947         RETURN((struct dt_key *)it->ozi_name);
00948 }
00949 
00950 static int osd_dir_it_key_size(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di)
00951 {
00952         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
00953         zap_attribute_t   *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00954         int                rc;
00955         ENTRY;
00956 
00957         if (it->ozi_pos <= 1) {
00958                 it->ozi_pos = 1;
00959                 RETURN(2);
00960         } else if (it->ozi_pos == 2) {
00961                 RETURN(3);
00962         }
00963 
00964         if ((rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za)) == 0)
00965                 rc = strlen(za->za_name);
00966 
00967         RETURN(rc);
00968 }
00969 
00970 static int osd_dir_it_rec(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di,
00971                           struct dt_rec *dtrec, __u32 attr)
00972 {
00973         struct osd_zap_it   *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
00974         struct lu_dirent    *lde = (struct lu_dirent *)dtrec;
00975         struct luz_direntry *zde = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_zde;
00976         zap_attribute_t     *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00977         int                  rc, namelen;
00978         ENTRY;
00979 
00980         if (it->ozi_pos <= 1) {
00981                 lde->lde_hash = cpu_to_le64(1);
00982                 strcpy(lde->lde_name, ".");
00983                 lde->lde_namelen = cpu_to_le16(1);
00984                 lde->lde_fid = *lu_object_fid(&it->ozi_obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
00985                 lde->lde_attrs = LUDA_FID;
00986                 /* append lustre attributes */
00987                 osd_it_append_attrs(lde, attr, 1, IFTODT(S_IFDIR));
00988                 lde->lde_reclen = cpu_to_le16(lu_dirent_calc_size(1, attr));
00989                 it->ozi_pos = 1;
00990                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00991 
00992         } else if (it->ozi_pos == 2) {
00993                 lde->lde_hash = cpu_to_le64(2);
00994                 strcpy(lde->lde_name, "..");
00995                 lde->lde_namelen = cpu_to_le16(2);
00996                 lde->lde_attrs = LUDA_FID;
00997                 /* append lustre attributes */
00998                 osd_it_append_attrs(lde, attr, 2, IFTODT(S_IFDIR));
00999                 lde->lde_reclen = cpu_to_le16(lu_dirent_calc_size(2, attr));
01000                 rc = osd_find_parent_fid(env, &it->ozi_obj->oo_dt, &lde->lde_fid);
01001 
01002                 /* ENOENT happens at the root of filesystem so ignore it */
01003                 if (rc == -ENOENT)
01004                         rc = 0;
01005                 GOTO(out, rc);
01006         }
01007 
01008         LASSERT(lde);
01009 
01010         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za);
01011         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01012                 GOTO(out, rc);
01013 
01014         lde->lde_hash = cpu_to_le64(osd_zap_cursor_serialize(it->ozi_zc));
01015         namelen = strlen(za->za_name);
01016         if (namelen > NAME_MAX)
01017                 GOTO(out, rc = -EOVERFLOW);
01018         strcpy(lde->lde_name, za->za_name);
01019         lde->lde_namelen = cpu_to_le16(namelen);
01020 
01021         if (za->za_integer_length != 8 || za->za_num_integers < 3) {
01022                 CERROR("%s: unsupported direntry format: %d %d\n",
01023                        osd_obj2dev(it->ozi_obj)->od_svname,
01024                        za->za_integer_length, (int)za->za_num_integers);
01025 
01026                 GOTO(out, rc = -EIO);
01027         }
01028 
01029         rc = -zap_lookup(it->ozi_zc->zc_objset, it->ozi_zc->zc_zapobj,
01030                          za->za_name, za->za_integer_length, 3, zde);
01031         if (rc)
01032                 GOTO(out, rc);
01033 
01034         lde->lde_fid = zde->lzd_fid;
01035         lde->lde_attrs = LUDA_FID;
01036 
01037         /* append lustre attributes */
01038         osd_it_append_attrs(lde, attr, namelen, zde->lzd_reg.zde_type);
01039 
01040         lde->lde_reclen = cpu_to_le16(lu_dirent_calc_size(namelen, attr));
01041 
01042 out:
01043         RETURN(rc);
01044 }
01045 
01046 static int osd_dir_it_rec_size(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di,
01047                                __u32 attr)
01048 {
01049         struct osd_zap_it   *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01050         zap_attribute_t     *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
01051         size_t               namelen = 0;
01052         int                  rc;
01053         ENTRY;
01054 
01055         if (it->ozi_pos <= 1)
01056                 namelen = 1;
01057         else if (it->ozi_pos == 2)
01058                 namelen = 2;
01059 
01060         if (namelen > 0) {
01061                 rc = lu_dirent_calc_size(namelen, attr);
01062                 RETURN(rc);
01063         }
01064 
01065         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za);
01066         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01067                 RETURN(rc);
01068 
01069         if (za->za_integer_length != 8 || za->za_num_integers < 3) {
01070                 CERROR("%s: unsupported direntry format: %d %d\n",
01071                        osd_obj2dev(it->ozi_obj)->od_svname,
01072                        za->za_integer_length, (int)za->za_num_integers);
01073                 RETURN(-EIO);
01074         }
01075 
01076         namelen = strlen(za->za_name);
01077         if (namelen > NAME_MAX)
01078                 RETURN(-EOVERFLOW);
01079 
01080         rc = lu_dirent_calc_size(namelen, attr);
01081 
01082         RETURN(rc);
01083 }
01084 
01085 static __u64 osd_dir_it_store(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di)
01086 {
01087         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01088         __u64              pos;
01089         ENTRY;
01090 
01091         if (it->ozi_pos <= 2)
01092                 pos = it->ozi_pos;
01093         else
01094                 pos = osd_zap_cursor_serialize(it->ozi_zc);
01095 
01096         RETURN(pos);
01097 }
01098 
01099 /*
01100  * return status :
01101  *  rc == 0 -> end of directory.
01102  *  rc >  0 -> ok, proceed.
01103  *  rc <  0 -> error.  ( EOVERFLOW  can be masked.)
01104  */
01105 static int osd_dir_it_load(const struct lu_env *env,
01106                         const struct dt_it *di, __u64 hash)
01107 {
01108         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01109         struct osd_object *obj = it->ozi_obj;
01110         zap_attribute_t   *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
01111         int                rc;
01112         ENTRY;
01113 
01114         /* reset the cursor */
01115         zap_cursor_fini(it->ozi_zc);
01116         osd_obj_cursor_init_serialized(it->ozi_zc, obj, hash);
01117 
01118         if (hash <= 2) {
01119                 it->ozi_pos = hash;
01120                 rc = +1;
01121         } else {
01122                 it->ozi_pos = 3;
01123                 /* to return whether the end has been reached */
01124                 rc = osd_index_retrieve_skip_dots(it, za);
01125                 if (rc == 0)
01126                         rc = +1;
01127                 else if (rc == -ENOENT)
01128                         rc = 0;
01129         }
01130 
01131         RETURN(rc);
01132 }
01133 
01134 struct dt_index_operations osd_dir_ops = {
01135         .dio_lookup         = osd_dir_lookup,
01136         .dio_declare_insert = osd_declare_dir_insert,
01137         .dio_insert         = osd_dir_insert,
01138         .dio_declare_delete = osd_declare_dir_delete,
01139         .dio_delete         = osd_dir_delete,
01140         .dio_it     = {
01141                 .init     = osd_dir_it_init,
01142                 .fini     = osd_index_it_fini,
01143                 .get      = osd_dir_it_get,
01144                 .put      = osd_dir_it_put,
01145                 .next     = osd_dir_it_next,
01146                 .key      = osd_dir_it_key,
01147                 .key_size = osd_dir_it_key_size,
01148                 .rec      = osd_dir_it_rec,
01149                 .rec_size = osd_dir_it_rec_size,
01150                 .store    = osd_dir_it_store,
01151                 .load     = osd_dir_it_load
01152         }
01153 };
01154 
01155 /*
01156  * Primitives for index files using binary keys.
01157  */
01158 
01159 /* key integer_size is 8 */
01160 static int osd_prepare_key_uint64(struct osd_object *o, __u64 *dst,
01161                                   const struct dt_key *src)
01162 {
01163         int size;
01164 
01165         LASSERT(dst);
01166         LASSERT(src);
01167 
01168         /* align keysize to 64bit */
01169         size = (o->oo_keysize + sizeof(__u64) - 1) / sizeof(__u64);
01170         size *= sizeof(__u64);
01171 
01172         LASSERT(size <= MAXNAMELEN);
01173 
01174         if (unlikely(size > o->oo_keysize))
01175                 memset(dst + o->oo_keysize, 0, size - o->oo_keysize);
01176         memcpy(dst, (const char *)src, o->oo_keysize);
01177 
01178         return (size/sizeof(__u64));
01179 }
01180 
01181 static int osd_index_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01182                         struct dt_rec *rec, const struct dt_key *key)
01183 {
01184         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01185         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01186         __u64             *k = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_key64;
01187         int                rc;
01188         ENTRY;
01189 
01190         rc = osd_prepare_key_uint64(obj, k, key);
01191 
01192         rc = -zap_lookup_uint64(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object,
01193                                 k, rc, obj->oo_recusize, obj->oo_recsize,
01194                                 (void *)rec);
01195         RETURN(rc == 0 ? 1 : rc);
01196 }
01197 
01198 static int osd_declare_index_insert(const struct lu_env *env,
01199                                     struct dt_object *dt,
01200                                     const struct dt_rec *rec,
01201                                     const struct dt_key *key,
01202                                     struct thandle *th)
01203 {
01204         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01205         struct osd_thandle *oh;
01206         ENTRY;
01207 
01208         LASSERT(th != NULL);
01209         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01210 
01211         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
01212 
01213         dmu_tx_hold_bonus(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_db->db_object);
01214 
01215         /* It is not clear what API should be used for binary keys, so we pass
01216          * a null name which has the side effect of over-reserving space,
01217          * accounting for the worst case. See zap_count_write() */
01218         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_db->db_object, TRUE, NULL);
01219 
01220         RETURN(0);
01221 }
01222 
01223 static int osd_index_insert(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01224                             const struct dt_rec *rec, const struct dt_key *key,
01225                             struct thandle *th, int ignore_quota)
01226 {
01227         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01228         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01229         struct osd_thandle *oh;
01230         __u64              *k = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_key64;
01231         int                 rc;
01232         ENTRY;
01233 
01234         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
01235         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
01236         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
01237         LASSERT(th != NULL);
01238 
01239         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01240 
01241         rc = osd_prepare_key_uint64(obj, k, key);
01242 
01243         /* Insert (key,oid) into ZAP */
01244         rc = -zap_add_uint64(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object,
01245                              k, rc, obj->oo_recusize, obj->oo_recsize,
01246                              (void *)rec, oh->ot_tx);
01247         RETURN(rc);
01248 }
01249 
01250 static int osd_declare_index_delete(const struct lu_env *env,
01251                                     struct dt_object *dt,
01252                                     const struct dt_key *key,
01253                                     struct thandle *th)
01254 {
01255         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01256         struct osd_thandle *oh;
01257         ENTRY;
01258 
01259         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
01260         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
01261         LASSERT(th != NULL);
01262         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
01263 
01264         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01265         dmu_tx_hold_zap(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_db->db_object, TRUE, NULL);
01266 
01267         RETURN(0);
01268 }
01269 
01270 static int osd_index_delete(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01271                             const struct dt_key *key, struct thandle *th)
01272 {
01273         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01274         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01275         struct osd_thandle *oh;
01276         __u64              *k = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_key64;
01277         int                 rc;
01278         ENTRY;
01279 
01280         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
01281         LASSERT(th != NULL);
01282         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01283 
01284         rc = osd_prepare_key_uint64(obj, k, key);
01285 
01286         /* Remove binary key from the ZAP */
01287         rc = -zap_remove_uint64(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object,
01288                                 k, rc, oh->ot_tx);
01289         RETURN(rc);
01290 }
01291 
01292 static int osd_index_it_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di,
01293                             const struct dt_key *key)
01294 {
01295         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01296         struct osd_object *obj = it->ozi_obj;
01297         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01298         ENTRY;
01299 
01300         LASSERT(it);
01301         LASSERT(it->ozi_zc);
01302 
01303         /*
01304          * XXX: we need a binary version of zap_cursor_move_to_key()
01305          *      to implement this API */
01306         if (*((const __u64 *)key) != 0)
01307                 CERROR("NOT IMPLEMETED YET (move to "LPX64")\n",
01308                        *((__u64 *)key));
01309 
01310         zap_cursor_fini(it->ozi_zc);
01311         zap_cursor_init(it->ozi_zc, osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object);
01312         it->ozi_reset = 1;
01313 
01314         RETURN(+1);
01315 }
01316 
01317 static int osd_index_it_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
01318 {
01319         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01320         zap_attribute_t   *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
01321         int                rc;
01322         ENTRY;
01323 
01324         if (it->ozi_reset == 0)
01325                 zap_cursor_advance(it->ozi_zc);
01326         it->ozi_reset = 0;
01327 
01328         /*
01329          * According to current API we need to return error if it's last entry.
01330          * zap_cursor_advance() does not return any value. So we need to call
01331          * retrieve to check if there is any record.  We should make
01332          * changes to Iterator API to not return status for this API
01333          */
01334         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za);
01335         if (rc == -ENOENT)
01336                 RETURN(+1);
01337 
01338         RETURN((rc));
01339 }
01340 
01341 static struct dt_key *osd_index_it_key(const struct lu_env *env,
01342                                        const struct dt_it *di)
01343 {
01344         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01345         struct osd_object *obj = it->ozi_obj;
01346         zap_attribute_t   *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
01347         int                rc = 0;
01348         ENTRY;
01349 
01350         it->ozi_reset = 0;
01351         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za);
01352         if (rc)
01353                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
01354 
01355         /* the binary key is stored in the name */
01356         memcpy(&it->ozi_key, za->za_name, obj->oo_keysize);
01357 
01358         RETURN((struct dt_key *)&it->ozi_key);
01359 }
01360 
01361 static int osd_index_it_key_size(const struct lu_env *env,
01362                                 const struct dt_it *di)
01363 {
01364         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01365         struct osd_object *obj = it->ozi_obj;
01366         RETURN(obj->oo_keysize);
01367 }
01368 
01369 static int osd_index_it_rec(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di,
01370                             struct dt_rec *rec, __u32 attr)
01371 {
01372         zap_attribute_t   *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
01373         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01374         struct osd_object *obj = it->ozi_obj;
01375         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01376         __u64             *k = osd_oti_get(env)->oti_key64;
01377         int                rc;
01378         ENTRY;
01379 
01380         it->ozi_reset = 0;
01381         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za);
01382         if (rc)
01383                 RETURN(rc);
01384 
01385         rc = osd_prepare_key_uint64(obj, k, (const struct dt_key *)za->za_name);
01386 
01387         rc = -zap_lookup_uint64(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object,
01388                                 k, rc, obj->oo_recusize, obj->oo_recsize,
01389                                 (void *)rec);
01390         RETURN(rc);
01391 }
01392 
01393 static __u64 osd_index_it_store(const struct lu_env *env,
01394                                 const struct dt_it *di)
01395 {
01396         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01397 
01398         it->ozi_reset = 0;
01399         RETURN((__u64)zap_cursor_serialize(it->ozi_zc));
01400 }
01401 
01402 static int osd_index_it_load(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di,
01403                              __u64 hash)
01404 {
01405         struct osd_zap_it *it = (struct osd_zap_it *)di;
01406         struct osd_object *obj = it->ozi_obj;
01407         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
01408         zap_attribute_t   *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
01409         int                rc;
01410         ENTRY;
01411 
01412         /* reset the cursor */
01413         zap_cursor_fini(it->ozi_zc);
01414         zap_cursor_init_serialized(it->ozi_zc, osd->od_os,
01415                                    obj->oo_db->db_object, hash);
01416         it->ozi_reset = 0;
01417 
01418         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->ozi_zc, za);
01419         if (rc == 0)
01420                 RETURN(+1);
01421         else if (rc == -ENOENT)
01422                 RETURN(0);
01423 
01424         RETURN(rc);
01425 }

01431         .dio_declare_delete     = osd_declare_index_delete,
01432         .dio_delete             = osd_index_delete,
01433         .dio_it = {

01435                 .fini           = osd_index_it_fini,
01436                 .get            = osd_index_it_get,
01437                 .put            = osd_index_it_put,
01438                 .next           = osd_index_it_next,
01439                 .key            = osd_index_it_key,
01440                 .key_size       = osd_index_it_key_size,
01441                 .rec            = osd_index_it_rec,
01442                 .store          = osd_index_it_store,
01443                 .load           = osd_index_it_load
01444         }

01447 struct osd_metadnode_it {
01448         struct osd_device       *mit_dev;
01449         __u64                    mit_pos;
01450         struct lu_fid            mit_fid;
01451         int                      mit_prefetched;
01452         __u64                    mit_prefetched_dnode;
01453 };
01454 
01455 static struct dt_it *osd_zfs_otable_it_init(const struct lu_env *env,
01456                                             struct dt_object *dt, __u32 attr)
01457 {
01458         struct osd_device       *dev   = osd_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
01459         struct osd_metadnode_it *it;
01460         ENTRY;
01461 
01462         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(it);
01463         if (unlikely(it == NULL))
01464                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
01465 
01466         it->mit_dev = dev;
01467 
01468         /* XXX: dmu_object_next() does NOT find dnodes allocated
01469          *      in the current non-committed txg, so we force txg
01470          *      commit to find all existing dnodes ... */
01471         txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(dev->od_os), 0ULL);
01472 
01473         RETURN((struct dt_it *)it);
01474 }
01475 
01476 static void osd_zfs_otable_it_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
01477 {
01478         struct osd_metadnode_it *it  = (struct osd_metadnode_it *)di;
01479 
01480         OBD_FREE_PTR(it);
01481 }
01482 
01483 static int osd_zfs_otable_it_get(const struct lu_env *env,
01484                                  struct dt_it *di, const struct dt_key *key)
01485 {
01486         return 0;
01487 }
01488 
01489 static void osd_zfs_otable_it_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
01490 {
01491 }
01492 
01493 #define OTABLE_PREFETCH         256
01494 
01495 static void osd_zfs_otable_prefetch(const struct lu_env *env,
01496                                     struct osd_metadnode_it *it)
01497 {
01498         struct osd_device       *dev = it->mit_dev;
01499         int                      rc;
01500 
01501         /* can go negative on the very first access to the iterator
01502          * or if some non-Lustre objects were found */
01503         if (unlikely(it->mit_prefetched < 0))
01504                 it->mit_prefetched = 0;
01505 
01506         if (it->mit_prefetched >= (OTABLE_PREFETCH >> 1))
01507                 return;
01508 
01509         if (it->mit_prefetched_dnode == 0)
01510                 it->mit_prefetched_dnode = it->mit_pos;
01511 
01512         while (it->mit_prefetched < OTABLE_PREFETCH) {
01513                 rc = -dmu_object_next(dev->od_os, &it->mit_prefetched_dnode,
01514                                       B_FALSE, 0);
01515                 if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01516                         break;
01517 
01518                 /* dmu_prefetch() was exported in 0.6.2, if you use with
01519                  * an older release, just comment it out - this is an
01520                  * optimization */
01521                 dmu_prefetch(dev->od_os, it->mit_prefetched_dnode, 0, 0);
01522 
01523                 it->mit_prefetched++;
01524         }
01525 }
01526 
01527 static int osd_zfs_otable_it_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
01528 {
01529         struct osd_metadnode_it *it  = (struct osd_metadnode_it *)di;
01530         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma;
01531         struct osd_device       *dev = it->mit_dev;
01532         nvlist_t                *nvbuf = NULL;
01533         uchar_t                 *v;
01534         __u64                    dnode;
01535         int                      rc, s;
01536 
01537         memset(&it->mit_fid, 0, sizeof(it->mit_fid));
01538 
01539         dnode = it->mit_pos;
01540         do {
01541                 rc = -dmu_object_next(dev->od_os, &it->mit_pos, B_FALSE, 0);
01542                 if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01543                         GOTO(out, rc = 1);
01544                 it->mit_prefetched--;
01545 
01546                 /* LMA is required for this to be a Lustre object.
01547                  * If there is no xattr skip it. */
01548                 rc = __osd_xattr_load(dev, it->mit_pos, &nvbuf);
01549                 if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01550                         continue;
01551 
01552                 LASSERT(nvbuf != NULL);
01553                 rc = -nvlist_lookup_byte_array(nvbuf, XATTR_NAME_LMA, &v, &s);
01554                 if (likely(rc == 0)) {
01555                         /* Lustre object */
01556                         lma = (struct lustre_mdt_attrs *)v;
01557                         lustre_lma_swab(lma);
01558                         it->mit_fid = lma->lma_self_fid;
01559                         nvlist_free(nvbuf);
01560                         break;
01561                 } else {
01562                         /* not a Lustre object, try next one */
01563                         nvlist_free(nvbuf);
01564                 }
01565 
01566         } while (1);
01567 
01568 
01569         /* we aren't prefetching in the above loop because the number of
01570          * non-Lustre objects is very small and we will be repeating very
01571          * rare. in case we want to use this to iterate over non-Lustre
01572          * objects (i.e. when we convert regular ZFS in Lustre) it makes
01573          * sense to initiate prefetching in the loop */
01574 
01575         /* 0 - there are more items, +1 - the end */
01576         if (likely(rc == 0))
01577                 osd_zfs_otable_prefetch(env, it);
01578 
01579         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "advance: %llu -> %llu "DFID": %d\n", dnode,
01580                it->mit_pos, PFID(&it->mit_fid), rc);
01581 
01582 out:
01583         return rc;
01584 }
01585 
01586 static struct dt_key *osd_zfs_otable_it_key(const struct lu_env *env,
01587                                             const struct dt_it *di)
01588 {
01589         return NULL;
01590 }

01593                                       const struct dt_it *di)
01594 {
01595         return sizeof(__u64);

01641                 .fini     = osd_zfs_otable_it_fini,
01642                 .get      = osd_zfs_otable_it_get,
01643                 .put      = osd_zfs_otable_it_put,

01645                 .key      = osd_zfs_otable_it_key,
01646                 .key_size = osd_zfs_otable_it_key_size,
01647                 .rec      = osd_zfs_otable_it_rec,
01648                 .store    = osd_zfs_otable_it_store,
01649                 .load     = osd_zfs_otable_it_load,
01650                 .key_rec  = osd_zfs_otable_it_key_rec,
01651         }

01653 
01654 int osd_index_try(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01655                 const struct dt_index_features *feat)
01656 {
01657         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01658         int rc = 0;
01659         ENTRY;
01660 
01661         down_read(&obj->oo_guard);
01662 
01663         /*
01664          * XXX: implement support for fixed-size keys sorted with natural
01665          *      numerical way (not using internal hash value)
01666          */
01667         if (feat->dif_flags & DT_IND_RANGE)
01668                 GOTO(out, rc = -ERANGE);
01669 
01670         if (unlikely(feat == &dt_otable_features)) {
01671                 dt->do_index_ops = &osd_zfs_otable_ops;
01672                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01673         }
01674 
01675         LASSERT(!dt_object_exists(dt) || obj->oo_db != NULL);
01676         if (likely(feat == &dt_directory_features)) {
01677                 if (!dt_object_exists(dt) || osd_object_is_zap(obj->oo_db))
01678                         dt->do_index_ops = &osd_dir_ops;
01679                 else
01680                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTDIR);
01681         } else if (unlikely(feat == &dt_acct_features)) {
01682                 LASSERT(fid_is_acct(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)));
01683                 dt->do_index_ops = &osd_acct_index_ops;
01684         } else if (dt->do_index_ops == NULL) {
01685                 /* For index file, we don't support variable key & record sizes
01686                  * and the key has to be unique */
01687                 if ((feat->dif_flags & ~DT_IND_UPDATE) != 0)
01688                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01689 
01690                 if (feat->dif_keysize_max > ZAP_MAXNAMELEN)
01691                         GOTO(out, rc = -E2BIG);
01692                 if (feat->dif_keysize_max != feat->dif_keysize_min)
01693                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01694 
01695                 /* As for the record size, it should be a multiple of 8 bytes
01696                  * and smaller than the maximum value length supported by ZAP.
01697                  */
01698                 if (feat->dif_recsize_max > ZAP_MAXVALUELEN)
01699                         GOTO(out, rc = -E2BIG);
01700                 if (feat->dif_recsize_max != feat->dif_recsize_min)
01701                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01702 
01703                 obj->oo_keysize = feat->dif_keysize_max;
01704                 obj->oo_recsize = feat->dif_recsize_max;
01705                 obj->oo_recusize = 1;
01706 
01707                 /* ZFS prefers to work with array of 64bits */
01708                 if ((obj->oo_recsize & 7) == 0) {
01709                         obj->oo_recsize >>= 3;
01710                         obj->oo_recusize = 8;
01711                 }
01712                 dt->do_index_ops = &osd_index_ops;
01713         }
01714 
01715 out:
01716         up_read(&obj->oo_guard);
01717 
01718         RETURN(rc);
01719 }
